info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 08 at 8:43PM EDT until June 08 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Monongalia County in northern West Virginia... Marion County in northern West Virginia... * Until 915 PM EDT. * At 843 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mannington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Morgantown, Fairmont, Westover, Mannington, Star City, Pleasant Valley, Winfield, Barrackville, Monongah, Granville, Fairview, and Cassville. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for northern West Virginia. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
